DOC.brief_summary: The general objective open , pilot study characterize biological parameter relate acute kidney injury among patient undergo programmed coronarography injection contrast material . The study focus two main factor may influence acute kidney injury : ( 1 ) sodium chloride hydration strategy versus sodium bicarbonate hydration strategy ( 2 ) presence oral L-carnitine treatment versus absence oral L-carnitine treatment . We also test potential interaction two factor .
DOC.brief_title: Preventing Contrast-induced Nephropathy : Evaluating Hydration Strategies L-carnitine Administration
DOC.criteria: The patient must give his/her inform sign consent The patient must insure beneficiary health insurance plan The patient schedule coronarography The patient come back hospital day 2 7 coronarography follow The patient moderate severe renal insufficiency ( glomerular filtration rate < 60 ml / min / 1.73 m^2 ) The patient oral antidiabetic treatment , diuretic treatment , within 48 hour precede coronarography Lack treatment ACE inhibitor ARA2 24 hour prior coronary The patient participate another study The patient exclusion period determine another study The patient judicial protection The patient kind guardianship The patient refuse sign consent form It impossible correctly inform patient The patient unable participate followup visit day 2 7 coronarography The patient pregnant breastfeed The patient take Lcarnitine The patient contra indication treatment use study Acute heart failure Infarction , acute phase Hemodialysis patient Myeloma Epileptic patient treat Depakine ( valproic acid ) ( carnitine low epilepsyrelated threshold speed metabolism Depakine )
